lines.text: Enter CHARLES, BURGUNDY, ALENCON, BASTARD OF ORLEANS, REIGNIER, JOAN LA PUCELLE, and forces

lines.speaker: charles
lines.text: These news, my lord, may cheer our drooping spirits: 'Tis said the stout Parisians do revolt And turn again unto the warlike French.

lines.speaker: alencon
lines.text: Then march to Paris, royal Charles of France, And keep not back your powers in dalliance.

lines.speaker: joan la pucelle
lines.text: Peace be amongst them, if they turn to us; Else, ruin combat with their palaces!

lines.speaker: scout
lines.text: Success unto our valiant general, And happiness to his accomplices!

lines.speaker: charles
lines.text: What tidings send our scouts? I prithee, speak.

lines.speaker: scout
lines.text: The English army, that divided was Into two parties, is now conjoined in one, And means to give you battle presently.

lines.speaker: charles
lines.text: Somewhat too sudden, sirs, the warning is; But we will presently provide for them.

lines.speaker: burgundy
lines.text: I trust the ghost of Talbot is not there: Now he is gone, my lord, you need not fear.

lines.speaker: joan la pucelle
lines.text: Of all base passions, fear is most accursed. Command the conquest, Charles, it shall be thine, Let Henry fret and all the world repine.

lines.speaker: charles
lines.text: Then on, my lords; and France be fortunate!
